content: On October 14, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League Championship Series (NLCS) by defeating the Cincinnati Reds 4-0 in Game 6. This victory secured their spot in the World Series, marking the Braves' first trip to the Fall Classic since their relocation to Atlanta in 1966. Greg Maddux delivered a stellar performance on the mound, pitching a complete game shutout and helping solidify the Braves' dominance that season, which ultimately led to their World Series championship.
